channel.title: Scarecrows' Original #317 Client
channel.description:
It's been a while since I've released anything to the community, so here's something I've been working on for the past few days. I kept the game frame #317 style but may take a look at replicating it to the #508 later on. I don't believe it's anything special but I do feel the community needs a clean #317 client. Currently the client version is 0.7, I'd appreciate ideas / bugs / problems with the client posted here as I have little idea on what else people would like to see in this client. Yes this is based off the original #317 deob, I'll most likely convert all features to the refactored #317 later.
Oh and I nearly forgot to add that this is completely open-source.
[b]Changelog[/b]
[code]Additions: * Change Server * Change Port * Change User ID (Still randomizes the UID on load) * Item, NPC, Object IDs (XML loading) * Open Interface * Drop Client * Lag Client * Players Nearby * NPCs Nearby * Player Coordinates * Mouse Coordinates * Debug Items, NPCs, Objects * FPS * Memory Usage * Use Less CPU * Chat Censor * Noclip * Server Status button to load in browser * HP Above Heads * Camera Movement * Game Settings UI added * Console box - warlock 999
Improvements: * Did some small refactoring for my own convenience * Conventions kept clean * Changed Node-IDs and a few other problems to perfect friends list * Replaced getText with getPassword for the password field (Got rid of depreciation)
Bug fixes: * Bar wouldn't show with HP Above Heads on * Player Coordinates would throw an out of bounds exception * Debugging for items would not show on ground * Port did not actually change ( /facepalm ) * Removed flames would cut out some of the background - zer0
Removed: * RuneScape logo loading from cache removed * Flames disabled * Disabled username and password field resetting[/code]
[b]Pictures:[/b]
[ul][li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/UI.png]Game Settings UI[/url][/li] [li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/jmenu1.png]File Menu[/url][/li] [li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/jmenu2.png]Tools Menu[/url][/li] [li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/jmenu3.png]Debug Menu[/url][/li] [li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/jmenu4.png]Misc Menu[/url][/li] [li][url=http://i264.photobucket.com/albums/ii168/scarecrow_ftw/jmenu5.png]Help Menu[/url][/li][/ul]
[b]Downloads:[/b]
The client provided below does not include the cache, you may just use any #317 cache. (Default directory is ./cache/)
[u]Client:[/u] http://www.filedropper.com/publicclient (458KB)
If needed I have included a blank #317 cache below.
[u]Cache:[/u] http://www.filedropper.com/cache (11.3MB)
[b]Other Credits:[/b]
- Moparisthebest for the blank #317 deob - Lin for ideas and opinions

item.title: Scarecrows' Original #317 Client
item.dc:creator: @K1ng_0f_K1ngs K1ng 0f K1ngs
item.description:
@K1ng_0f_K1ngs wrote:

Thank you, I appreciate all the comments. Any ideas or criticism though? I have absolutely no idea on what else to add.

Well there we have a problem… You want to add and add and add more things… If it’s useful and something that the community really would appreciate, I would love to see more things added. But as things look now, all you’re ever going to add is more GUI and Swing work… I CAN’T STAND THAT! Why fill up the client with all of these extra menus and buttons…?? Make a clean nice client, thats all I ever asks for… (Even though I really really like that you added the original 317 cache), (and not the 377 cache, which WAY to many people does). I also thinks it looks pretty clean… So yeah… Overall nice job, but next time, PLEASE except all of the Swing and GUI work…

Constructive criticism ^^ ;D

Read full topic

@Scarecrows:

Good job with this client. This community doesn’t really bother with client creation, it needs to be pushed forward, and you’ve given everyone a base to build off :). Although there was already Mopar’s client, but you’ve improved off of that.

item.title: Scarecrows' Original #317 Client
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

It’s been a while since I’ve released anything to the community, so here’s something I’ve been working on for the past few days. I kept the game frame #317 style but may take a look at replicating it to the #508 later on. I don’t believe it’s anything special but I do feel the community needs a clean #317 client. Currently the client version is 0.7, I’d appreciate ideas / bugs / problems with the client posted here as I have little idea on what else people would like to see in this client. Yes this is based off the original #317 deob, I’ll most likely convert all features to the refactored #317 later.

Oh and I nearly forgot to add that this is completely open-source.

Changelog

[code]Additions:

  • Change Server
  • Change Port
  • Change User ID (Still randomizes the UID on load)
  • Item, NPC, Object IDs (XML loading)
  • Open Interface
  • Drop Client
  • Lag Client
  • Players Nearby
  • NPCs Nearby
  • Player Coordinates
  • Mouse Coordinates
  • Debug Items, NPCs, Objects
  • FPS
  • Memory Usage
  • Use Less CPU
  • Chat Censor
  • Noclip
  • Server Status button to load in browser
  • HP Above Heads
  • Camera Movement
  • Game Settings UI added
  • Console box - warlock 999

Improvements:

  • Did some small refactoring for my own convenience
  • Conventions kept clean
  • Changed Node-IDs and a few other problems to perfect friends list
  • Replaced getText with getPassword for the password field (Got rid of depreciation)

Bug fixes:

  • Bar wouldn’t show with HP Above Heads on
  • Player Coordinates would throw an out of bounds exception
  • Debugging for items would not show on ground
  • Port did not actually change ( /facepalm )
  • Removed flames would cut out some of the background - zer0

Removed:

  • RuneScape logo loading from cache removed
  • Flames disabled
  • Disabled username and password field resetting[/code]

Pictures:

[ul][li]Game Settings UI[/li]
[li]File Menu[/li]
[li]Tools Menu[/li]
[li]Debug Menu[/li]
[li]Misc Menu[/li]
[li]Help Menu[/li][/ul]

Downloads:

The client provided below does not include the cache, you may just use any #317 cache. (Default directory is ./cache/)

Client: http://www.filedropper.com/publicclient (458KB)

If needed I have included a blank #317 cache below.

Cache: http://www.filedropper.com/cache (11.3MB)

Other Credits:

  • Moparisthebest for the blank #317 deob
  • Lin for ideas and opinions

Read full topic
